result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:03 am 
INCLUDES 16CF291, 16CF590, 15CF796, AND 15CF184. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Cana Laska. 
VRCW. 

PLEA HEARING IN 16CF291 AND 16CF590.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 16CF590: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (DC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: 
In 16CF291: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty.  


MOTION TO REVOKE DEOJ AND ENTER JUDGMENT IN 15CF796 AND 15CF184. 
State moves to enter judgment on Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater) in 15CF796 and on Ct. 1 (Forgery-Uttering/Repeater) in 15CF184. 
COURT grants. 

SENTENCING IN ALL FILES. 
Def makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation in 15CF184 ONLY: $350 restitution to Marathon Savings Bank to be paid at a rate of at least $25 per month. 
COURT finds the def entitled to jail credit: In 16CF291>>2 days. 
                                                                     : In 15CF796>>6 days. 
                                                                     : In 15CF184>>41 days. 

Adj: 11:18 am

Clerk Marisa.

INCLUDES 15CF184, 15CF796, AND 15CF826.

State moves to:

In 15CF826: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF184: Ct. 1 (Forgery-Uttering/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF796: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & defers entry of judgment. 
Atty Zich makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: On both Counts>>DEOJ for 2 years with condtions as outlined in written agreement. 
State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ agreement, it will move to amend the charge in 15CF184 to State DC with $5 fine plus costs, and it will move to dismiss the charge in 15CF796. 
DEOJ Review set for November 17, 2017 at 10:45 am in Br. 3 Courtroom.
